intro: Psychotria chlorotica, commonly known as the green psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are predominantly green, with a smooth texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, clustered in small umbels, and are known to emit a faint fragrance. Psychotria chlorotica is often found in understory habitats of rainforests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
